summary.long: Ephesians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, To the saints who are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ, even as
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath chosen us in Him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before Him in love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having predestined us to be His own adopted children by Jesus Christ, according to the good pleasure of His will,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the praise of the glory of His grace, wherein He hath made us accepted in His Beloved:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in Whom we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of His grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherein He hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath made known unto us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He hath purposed in Himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that in the dispensation of the fullness of times He might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven and which are on earth, even in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Christ also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestined according to the purpose of Him who worketh all things after the counsel of His own will,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that we, who first trusted in Christ, should be to the praise of His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Christ ye also trusted after ye heard the word of truth, the Gospel of your salvation, in Whom also after ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is the pledge of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eyes of your understanding being enlightened, that ye may know what is the hope of His calling, and what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what is the exceeding greatness of His power toward us who believe, according to the working of His mighty power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which He wrought in Christ when He raised Him from the dead and set Him at His own right hand in the heavenly places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: far above all principality and power and might and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God hath put all things under His feet, and hath given Him to be the head over all things to the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is His body, the fullness of Him that filleth all in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you hath He quickened, who were dead in trespasses and sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherein in times past ye walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among these also we all had our manner of living in times past in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature the children of wrath, even as others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God, who is rich in mercy, because of His great love wherewith He loved us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together with Christ (by grace ye are saved),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hath raised us up together and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in His kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by grace are ye saved through faith, and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not by works, lest any man should boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are His workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath beforehand ordained, that we should walk in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, remember that ye, being in times past Gentiles in the flesh, who are called Uncircumcision by those who are called the Circumcision in the flesh so made by hands—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remember that at that time ye were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now in Christ Jesus, ye who once were far off have been brought nigh by the blood of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down the middle wall of partition between us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having abolished in His flesh the enmity, even the law of commandments contained in ordinances, that He might make in Himself one new man out of the two, so making peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that He might reconcile both unto God in one body by the cross, having slain the enmity thereby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came and preached peace to you who were afar off and to those who were nigh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for through Him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, ye are strangers and foreigners no more, but fellow citizens with the saints, and of the household of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom all the building, fitly framed together, groweth unto a holy temple in the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in Whom ye also are built together for a habitation of God through the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause I, Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if ye have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me toward you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how by revelation He made known unto me the mystery (as I wrote before in a few words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereby when ye read this, ye may understand my knowledge of the mystery of Christ),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which in other ages was not made known unto the sons of men, as it is now revealed unto His holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Gentiles should be fellow heirs, and of the same body, and partakers of His promise in Christ by the Gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I was made a minister according to the gift of the grace of God given unto me by the effectual working of His power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, is this grace given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to make all men see what is the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the world hath been hid in God, who created all things by Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the intent that now unto the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known through the church the manifold wisdom of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the eternal purpose which He hath purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I desire that ye faint not at my tribulations for you, which are your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from whom the whole family in Heaven and earth is named,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that He would grant you, according to the riches of His glory, to be strengthened with might by His Spirit in the inner man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: may be able to comprehend with all saints what is the breadth and length and depth and height,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to know the love of Christ, which surpasseth knowledge, that ye might be filled with all the fullness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now unto Him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beseech you that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all lowliness and meekness, with longsuffering, forbearing one another in love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: endeavoring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is one body and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore He saith, “When He ascended up on high, He led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the saying, “He ascended” — what does it mean but that He also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that descended is the same who also ascended up far above all heavens, that He might fill all things.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He gave some to be apostles, and some prophets, and some evangelists, and some pastors and teachers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the perfecting of the saints for the work of the ministry, and for the edifying of the body of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until we all come into the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that we henceforth be no longer children, tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine by the sleight of men and their cunning and craftiness, whereby they lie in wait to deceive;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but speaking the truth in love, may grow up into Him in all things, who is the Head, even Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from whom the whole body, fitly joined together and compacted by that which every joint supplieth, according to the effectual working in the measure of every part, maketh increase of the body unto the edifying of itself in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This I say, therefore, and testify in the Lord, that ye henceforth walk not as other Gentiles walk, in the vanity of their mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having the understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them because of the blindness of their heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, being past feeling, have given themselves over unto lasciviousness to work all uncleanness with greediness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye have not so learned Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if so it be that ye have heard Him and have been taught by Him as the truth is in Jesus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye put off, concerning your former manner of living, the old man which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that ye put on that new man, which after God is created in righteousness and true holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, putting away lying, let every man speak truth with his neighbor, for we are members one of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down on your wrath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither give place to the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him that stole steal no more, but rather let him labor, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to use in edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And grieve not the holy Spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and evil speaking be put away from you, with all malice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given Himself for us as an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness, let them not once be named among you, as becometh saints;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not befitting, but rather giving of thanks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this ye know: that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the Kingdom of Christ and of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no man deceive you with vain words, for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye not therefore partakers with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now ye are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is shameful even to speak of those things which are done by them in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light, for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore He saith: “Awake, thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, be ye not unwise, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: speaking to one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church, and He is the savior of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives even as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that He might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the Word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that He might present it to Himself a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but that it should be holy and without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He hat loveth his wife loveth himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh, but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are members of His body, of His flesh, and of His bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a great mystery, but I speak concerning Christ and the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself, and the wife see that she reverence her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honor thy father and mother,” which is the first commandment with promise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “that it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath, but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Servants, be obedient to those who are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as unto Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not with eyeservice as menpleasers, but as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with good will doing service, as to the Lord and not to men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive from the Lord, whether he be bond or free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye masters, do the same things unto them, forbearing threatening, knowing that your Master also is in Heaven; neither is there respect of persons with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put on the whole armor of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, take unto you the whole armor of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day and, having done all, to stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand therefore, having your loins girded about with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and your feet shod with the preparation of the Gospel of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above all, take the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And take the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the Word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And pray for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly to make known the mystery of the Gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I am an ambassador in bonds, that therein I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that ye also may know my affairs and how I do, Tychicus, a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent him unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know our affairs, and that he might comfort your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
